mitzvah_connection: Listening carefully and respecting our parents and teachers

cards.emotional_hook_en: This week is about feeling AWE!
cards.emotional_hook_he: 址砖指旨旨注址 址侄旨 注址 转职旨旨砖址转 执专职指!
cards.symbol_description: Two stone tablets glowing with golden light, with light rays streaming down from clouds above
cards.image_prompt: Create an illustration for a children's educational card introducing 'Yitro'. Central Element: Two stone tablets with rounded tops, glowing with warm golden light. Light rays stream down from soft clouds above. The tablets should look majestic but friendly. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon illustration for children ages 4-6. Bold primary colors for the tablets (warm stone color), soft pastel blue/cream background. Rounded shapes, thick clean outlines. Simple composition with the tablets as the clear focal point. Leave space at bottom for text. NEVER depict God in human form - only use light rays and clouds.
cards.teacher_script: This is Parshat Yitro! Do you see those special tablets? They're going to have very important words on them. This week, we're going to feel AWE - that's when something is SO amazing that it makes us go 'Wow!' Let's practice: put your hands on your cheeks and say 'WOW!'

cards.character_description_en: Moses is the leader of the Jewish people. He loves his family very much!
cards.character_description_he: 止砖侄 旨 址职执 注址 执砖职专指值. 旨 止值 侄转 执砖职驻址旨职转旨止 职止!
cards.image_prompt: Create a character portrait illustration for a children's educational card. Character: Moses wearing a brown robe, holding a wooden staff, with a gray beard and kind expressive eyes. Emotion: HAPPY and JOYFUL. His face shows a big warm smile, eyes crinkled with joy, arms open welcomingly. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold colors, soft pastel background (cream/light blue). Rounded, friendly design with large expressive eyes and thick clean outlines. Moses should fill most of the frame. Face clearly visible. Simple desert/tent background suggested. Leave space at bottom for text.
cards.teacher_script: This is Moses - Moshe! Look at his face. See how HAPPY he looks? His eyes are all crinkly and he has a big smile. Moses is so happy because he's about to see someone very special. When YOU feel happy, what does your face look like? Show me!

cards.character_trait: Wise advisor who gives good advice
cards.character_description_en: Yitro is Moses's father-in-law. He is very wise and helps Moses!
cards.character_description_he: 执转职专止 旨 止转值 止砖侄. 旨 职止 指指 职注止值专 职止砖侄!
cards.image_prompt: Create a character portrait for a children's educational card. Character: Jethro/Yitro wearing colorful Midianite-style robes (red, gold, purple patterns), with a gray beard and wise, kind expression. Emotion: PROUD. His face shows quiet pride - head held high, gentle smile, warm knowing eyes. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold primary colors on his robes, soft pastel background. Rounded, friendly design with large expressive eyes, thick clean outlines. Yitro should fill most of the frame. Simple desert background suggested. Leave space at bottom for text.
cards.teacher_script: This is Yitro! He's Moses's father-in-law - that means he's the father of Moses's wife. Look at Yitro's face. He looks PROUD. See how he holds his head up high? Yitro is proud of Moses for being such a good leader. When someone you love does something wonderful, you might feel proud too!

cards.title_he: 址驻职旨执砖指 址砖职旨值指
cards.english_description: Yitro comes to visit Moses in the desert. Moses runs to greet him with a big hug!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Hug like you missed someone SO much!
cards.image_prompt: Create an action scene for a children's educational card. Scene: Moses and Yitro hugging joyfully in the desert. Moses (brown robe, staff set aside, gray beard) embraces Yitro (colorful Midianite robes, gray beard). Both have huge smiles, eyes closed in joy. Key elements: Two men hugging warmly, tents in background, sunny sky. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold primary colors, soft pastel background. Rounded friendly characters, thick clean outlines. Show warmth and love. Dynamic but simple composition. Leave space at bottom for text.
cards.teacher_script: Look! Yitro came to visit Moses in the desert! Moses was SO happy to see him. He ran out to meet him and gave him a BIG hug! Can you show me how you hug someone you really missed? Give yourself a big hug! That's called SIMCHA - joy!

cards.title_he: 指注值爪指 址植指指
cards.english_description: Yitro sees Moses working too hard. He gives Moses wise advice about how to get help!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Point your finger like a wise advisor giving important advice!
cards.image_prompt: Create an action scene for a children's educational card. Scene: Yitro giving advice to Moses. Yitro (colorful robes, gray beard) gestures wisely while speaking, one finger raised helpfully. Moses (brown robe, gray beard) listens carefully with thoughtful expression. Key elements: Yitro pointing/gesturing, Moses listening attentively, simple tent background. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold colors, soft pastel background. Rounded friendly characters, thick outlines. Show caring conversation. Leave space at bottom for text.
cards.teacher_script: Yitro saw that Moses was working SO hard, all by himself! He said, 'Moses, you need helpers!' That's called giving EITZAH - advice. When someone gives you good advice, they're helping you! Can you point your finger like you're giving wise advice? Good advice helps people!

cards.english_description: All the people travel to Mount Sinai. They stand at the bottom of the big mountain!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Walk like you're climbing up, up, UP a big mountain!
cards.image_prompt: Create an action scene for a children's educational card. Scene: The Israelites arriving at Mount Sinai. Show a group of friendly-looking people (families with children, diverse ages) looking up at a magnificent mountain. Key elements: Tall mountain with peak in clouds, crowd of people looking up with wonder, clear blue sky. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold colors for people's robes (red, blue, yellow), soft pastel sky. Rounded friendly characters, thick outlines. Mountain should look impressive but not scary. Leave space at bottom for text.
cards.teacher_script: The whole Jewish people traveled to a very special mountain called Sinai - HAR Sinai! Can you say HAR? It means mountain! They walked and walked until they got there. Show me how you walk when you're going UP a mountain - up, up, UP! They all stood at the bottom and looked UP at the big, big mountain.

cards.english_description: Thunder booms! Lightning flashes! The shofar blows! The whole mountain shakes!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Shake like the mountain! SHAKE SHAKE SHAKE!
cards.image_prompt: Create an action scene for a children's educational card. Scene: Mount Sinai with thunder and lightning, but shown in a non-scary, awe-inspiring way. The mountain trembles with motion lines. Key elements: Mountain with smoke/clouds at top, lightning bolts in sky (stylized, not scary), people at bottom looking up with amazement (not fear), warm golden light through the clouds. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold colors, dramatic but friendly. The scene should feel AMAZING, not frightening. Thick outlines, rounded shapes. Leave space at bottom for text. NEVER show God as a person - only light rays and clouds.
cards.teacher_script: Then something AMAZING happened! The mountain started to SHAKE! SHAKE SHAKE SHAKE! Thunder went BOOM BOOM BOOM! Lightning flashed! A shofar blew TEKIAH! And there was a big voice - a KOL - from the mountain! Everyone was SO amazed! Can you shake like the mountain? SHAKE SHAKE SHAKE!

cards.title_he: 注植砖侄专侄转 址执旨职旨专止转
cards.english_description: Everyone listens very, very carefully. They hear very special words - the Ten Commandments!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Put your hand to your ear and listen VERY carefully!
cards.image_prompt: Create an action scene for a children's educational card. Scene: The Israelites listening carefully to the Ten Commandments. Show people with hands cupped to ears, children and adults together, all looking up with focused, reverent expressions. Key elements: People listening intently, golden light rays from above, peaceful focused expressions, two tablets visible in golden light above (not held by anyone). Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold colors for people, soft warm golden light from above. Rounded friendly characters, thick outlines. Serene but important moment. Leave space at bottom for text. NEVER show God as a person - only light and tablets.
cards.teacher_script: Everyone got very, very quiet. They listened SO carefully - SHAMA! Can you put your hand to your ear like you're listening? The special words came from the mountain. These were the most important rules ever - the Ten Commandments! Like 'Honor your mommy and daddy!' Can you listen very, very carefully like the Jewish people did?

cards.torah_talk_instruction: Sit in a circle and share!
cards.image_prompt: Create an illustration for a children's discussion card. Theme: Children at Mount Sinai wondering about the experience. Show 2-3 children in biblical clothing with thoughtful, wondering expressions - hands on chins, looking up curiously, mixed emotions of curiosity and wonder. Simple mountain silhouette in background. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Soft warm colors, peaceful mood. Rounded friendly characters with large expressive eyes, thick outlines. Leave significant space at bottom for questions. No text in image.
cards.teacher_script: Let's sit in a Torah Talk circle! Look at these feeling faces. When the thunder boomed and the mountain shook, how do you think the children there felt? Can you point to a face? Maybe surprised? Maybe a little scared but also excited? Let's go around the circle - everyone pick a feeling face!

questions.question_en: How do you think Moses felt when he was working SO hard all by himself?
questions.question_he: 值职 址转指旨 止砖值 砖侄止旨砖侄 执专职执旨砖 职旨砖侄注指址 指旨 指旨职 拽指砖侄 职址?

questions.question_en: Has anyone ever helped YOU when something was too hard? How did you feel?
questions.question_he: 址执 执砖侄旨 值 驻址旨注址 注指址专 职指 职旨砖侄址旨砖侄旨旨 指指 拽指砖侄 执址旨?

cards.torah_talk_instruction: Sit in a circle and share!
cards.image_prompt: Create an illustration for a children's discussion card. Theme: Getting help from someone who cares. Show Moses and Yitro in thoughtful, wondering poses - both looking contemplative, perhaps Yitro with hand on Moses's shoulder supportively. Warm, caring mood. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Soft warm colors, peaceful reflective mood. Rounded friendly characters with large expressive eyes, thick outlines. Simple tent background. Leave significant space at bottom for questions. No text in image.
cards.teacher_script: Torah Talk time! Moses was working SO hard. He was tired! Then Yitro came and helped him. That's what families do! Can you think of a time when something was really hard and someone helped you? How did that make you feel? Let's share in our circle!

cards.example_sentence_he: 执转职专止 指转址 职止砖侄 注值爪指 止指!
cards.image_prompt: Create an illustration for a Hebrew vocabulary card teaching 'Advice' (Eitzah). Show a wise elderly figure (could be a grandparent) gently speaking to a child, with the child looking up attentively and thoughtfully. A lightbulb or gentle rays of light near the child's head to show they're learning. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold primary colors, soft pastel background. Simple, focused composition. Rounded friendly characters, thick outlines. Leave space for Hebrew word at top and English at bottom.
cards.teacher_script: Our Power Word is EITZAH! Can you say it? Eitzah! It means 'advice.' When someone who loves you helps you know what to do, that's eitzah! Yitro gave Moses eitzah. Who gives YOU good eitzah? Maybe your mommy? Your daddy? Your teacher?

cards.example_sentence_en: The people stood still and did shama!
cards.example_sentence_he: 指注指 注指址 职砖指址注!
cards.image_prompt: Create an illustration for a Hebrew vocabulary card teaching 'Listen' (Shama). Show a child with hand cupped to ear, eyes closed in concentration, clearly listening carefully. Sound waves or music notes coming toward the ear. Peaceful, focused expression. Style: Vivid, high-contrast cartoon for ages 4-6. Bold primary colors (child's clothing), soft pastel background. Simple, focused composition. Rounded friendly character with large expressive features, thick outlines. Leave space for Hebrew word at top and English at bottom.
cards.teacher_script: Our second Power Word is SHAMA! Can you say it? Shama! It means 'listen.' The Jewish people did shama at the mountain - they listened SO carefully! Let's practice shama - put your hand to your ear and close your eyes. What do you hear? That's doing shama!
